name: Joe Manganiello
religion: Joe Manganiello was raised Catholic, but appears to be less devout these days.
politicalViews: He is a fan of Ayn Rand, a lover of small government, and a defender of gay marriage.
author: Caitlin Frye

content.text: Joe Manganiello was born in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and raised in a Mt. Lebanon, a suburb just outside the city.
Manganiello was raised Catholic and attended a Roman Catholic elementary school.

content.sourceTitle: TrueBlood hunk Joe Manganiello declares himself a Rand fan, drives gay leftover bots (even more) nuts.
content.text: And apparently the former altar boy
believed what the nuns told him, at least for a while. He wanted desperately to become a werewolf and he was pretty sure God would make that happen. He said,

content.sourceTitle: How Joe Manganiello got his monster physique.
content.text: I went to church every morning at 6 a.m. praying that God would turn me into a werewolf. I'd heard as a little kid that if you pray hard enough and your faith is pure, God will answer you. But after a few weeks of praying with all of my heart, it wasn't happening. So I started thinking there wasn't a God, it's all a big gyp.

content.sourceTitle: How Joe Manganiello got his monster physique.
content.text: Now that he plays a werewolf on the TV show , Manganiello says he jokes with the show's creator that he's brought him back to Jesus.
But he's joking. And it looks like laughing about religion is one of his past times. He follows and retweets quotes from  like this one:
Jesus died for your sins, but he didn't really die, so it doesn't really count. #SeeYouInHellSuckers
But then again, his Catholic past hasn't completely left him. When asked if he would like to play Batman some day, he said,

content.sourceTitle: True Blood's Joe Manganiello Talks 'Man of Steel' & 'Batman' Reboot.
content.text: From your mouth to God's ears, man. I mean of course.

content.sourceTitle: joemanganiello: My prayers go out to everyone …
content.text: Plus he sent out prayers over Twitter after the Boston Marathon bombing in 2013.

My hunch is that Manganiello is more lapsed than he is Catholic, but I wouldn't be much surprised if one of you readers pointed me to a picture of him walking out of church. If you disagree or you know more, let us know in the comments.

content.sourceTitle: TrueBlood hunk Joe Manganiello declares himself a Rand fan, drives gay leftover bots (even more) nuts.
content.text: Manganiello is much less forthcoming about his political philosophy than his Catholic past. He declared Ayn Rand's  to be his favorite book,

content.sourceTitle: joemanganiello: I believe in small government, …
content.text: and he posted on Twitter that he believes in small government.
So maybe that means he favors a libertarian or conservative government, but he's never said as much.

content.sourceTitle: Joe Manganiello of 'Magic Mike' on stripping, Manhole.
content.text: But one issue about which he appears to care deeply is gay rights–which could support both libertarian and liberal views. He has posed on the cover of  magazine, spoke at an  for the Human Rights Campaign,

content.sourceTitle: 'True Blood's' Joe Manganiello Says He Beat Up Bullies In 'It Gets Better' PSA.
content.text: and recorded a video for the It Gets Better campaign.
He said the issue is a personal one for him:

content.sourceTitle: Joe Manganiello of 'Magic Mike' on stripping, Manhole.
content.text: I have a lot of friends in the gay community, stemming from drama school to working in Hollywood and, for me, it's about sticking up for the rights of my friends when I think stupid issues are being made of things.

So he's a lover of small government, possibly Libertarian, and a gay rights activist. It looks like he's slightly outside the box of your typical Hollywood star. If Manganiello starts speaking out against Obamacare, talking about Ron Paul, or anything else you think we'll find interesting, let us know in the comments! Thanks, readers.
